name: ALL May 2025 Graduates: Share your Post-Grad Plans!
description:
The Career Center kindly asks all May 2025 graduates to complete the Next Destination Survey to help future graduates. The data collected really does impact our future graduates and provides a guide for students, alumni and employers!  The link is below. Thank you for taking the time to complete it. 
Next Destination Survey
host: College of Engineering - OSDS, The Career Center

name: Test Event 4
description: Testing

name: Annual Health Psychology Research Showcase
description:
Hello!
We are so very excited for the second Annual Health Psychology Research Showcase.  This is a half-day showcase in which the faculty and students of the Health Psychology Ph.D. program will give poster presentations on their work.
This showcase will also feature a panel of Alumni who will share their experience in the program and both their academic and professional trajectories. 
Refreshments will be provided. 

 
This event is meant to be fun! This is intended to be a low-stakes celebration of our program and the work we do! This showcase helps open the floor for collaboration across members of the program and to share the work we do with those interested in Health Psychology. This showcase provides space to engage with members in our program and community in a fun way! This will also provide an excellent opportunity for students to practice giving poster talks, receive feedback, and for prospective students to see what this program is all about. This event will be held on campus, at the Student Union in rooms 262 (panel) and 261 (posters and refreshments). Please RSVP to this event!

name: Graduation Send-off
description: Come celebrate our graduates with some Auntie Anne's pretzels and Starbucks coffee to supercharge your studying experience!

name: Undergraduates: Lee College of Engineering Academic Experience Annual Survey
description:
Undergraduates in the College of Engineering, please consider taking a few moments to complete the brief college's annual student "Academic Experience" survey.  This survey is open to all undergraduates enrolled in the Lee College of Engineering and will be available until 5/13.
We value your thoughts and feedback about your educational/academic experiences in the college. 
This is a general link, and no personal data is being collected.  You may use the anonymous link to access the survey. You may also copy and paste it into the browser of your choice.  
 https://surveys.qualtrics.charlotte.edu/jfe/form/SV_3giGjFZHZimGtim
We thank you for your time.

description:

name: Student Game Showcase
description:
The Student Game Showcase is an exciting new event highlighting Charlotte's talented and hard-working community of student game developers. Join us for an evening of playing games and celebrating the work of creative and passionate Charlotte students!
 
Interested in having your game at the showcase? Check out the submission instructions and requirements here!
host: The International Game Developers Association at the University of North Carolina at Charlotte

name: Wawa study fuel
description: The WAWA study Fuel is a fantastic academic support and wellness initiative aimed at helping residents stay focused and energized while they hit the books. The goal of this program is to foster a productive and stress-free study atmosphere by offering quiet, dedicated study spaces along with healthy snacks and personalized assistance. Residents can book study rooms during those hectic academic times, and the RA on duty will bring snacks and drinks right to them—giving them the brain fuel they need and a little extra motivation to keep pushing through. It’s a straightforward yet powerful way to enhance motivation, prevent burnout, and cultivate a supportive academic community right in the residence hall.

name: Intersectional Justice Alliance Weekly Meeting
description: Weekly meetings to discuss and plan ways to educate, understand, and act on our issues. Our current issue is immigration. We want to understand how UNCC and Charlotte feel about immigration and the problems and conflicts surrounding immigration. We then want to take this information and educate the community and act to solve issues.
host: Intersectional Justice Alliance at UNC Charlotte

name: SKY@CHARLOTTE Weekly Meeting
description: Join us at SKY@Charlotte for our weekly meetings where we start with a fun activity, followed by soothing guided breathing exercises and meditation led by our instructors. Afterward, we make time for socializing, creating a perfect balance of relaxation and connection. Come experience it for yourself!

name: ACM Weekly Meeting
description:
For Spring 2025, ACM will meet every Wednesday evening in Woodward 154 from 5:30 to 7:00. Students and prospective members should always feel free to drop in late or leave early as needed.
During the first half of our meeting, we usually spend some time socializing and checking in with our peers, since networking is such an important professional skill to develop. For the rest of the time, we'll look at programming/coding problem together and split into pair programming groups to try and come up with solutions collaboratively. We will also set aside some time to discuss current topics and interests in tech and/or spend additional time workshopping resumes or interview skills with our peers.

name: Presidents' Leadership Workshop
description:
This workshop will help you learn how to lead your student organization, delegate tasks and authority, and learn about the resources and benefits available to you as a registered student organization. This workshop typically runs 1 hour and 15 minutes, leaving 15 minutes at the end for conversation and questions. Be ready to participate and share the great things your organization is doing!
 
This workshop is required as a part of the annual registration requirements for student organizations.
 
Contact acholula@charlotte.edu for any and all questions regarding this workshop.

name: College of Engineering Senior Design Expo   Friday, May 2
description:
Students, we encourage to STOP BY to see what your future holds!  Great an insider's look into this program and the expectations. 
We will have nearly 100 projects on display. During the Expo, you will observe how our students, industry partners, and research departments work together to solve design problems. 
Projects on display will also include department and competition projects from the Mechanical Engineering, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Engineering Technology departments.
- First-semester students will present a poster showcasing the design work they have done, while second-semester students will display the results of their design implementations.
The event will be held at UNC Charlotte, Barnhardt Student Activity Center, inside Halton Arena, from 11:00 AM to 3:00 PM.  Friday, May 2nd  
Learn more at: Senior Design Program - William States Lee College of Engineering  and at
 Engineering Senior Design Expo - University of North Carolina at Charlotte

name: Late Night Breakfast
description: The Late Night Breakfast is a long-standing UNC Charlotte tradition that happens on the Last Day of Classes. Students come out for a free late-night meal served by University Administrators and Staff before jumping into studying for Final Exams. Bring your dance moves and big appetite!

name: GIS End of the Semester Dinner
description:
As we wrap up another fantastic semester, we’re excited to invite you to our End-of-Semester Dinner! Let’s come together to celebrate our accomplishments, reflect on the semester's events, and look ahead to even greater opportunities. 
What’s on the agenda?

Presentation from professionals from AON (UNCC GIS Alumni!)
A delicious meal served with great company 
Recap of the incredible events we attended this semester 
Discussion of exciting event opportunities for next semester 
Acknowledgment of graduating seniors

This dinner is a wonderful way to connect with fellow members, share ideas, and celebrate the growth of our Gamma Iota Sigma Alpha Tau chapter.
📅 Date: 5/1/2025🕒 Time: 6:00pm - 8:00pm📍 Location: Student Union 200

name: CAPS Help Desk
location: Atkins; First Floor Atrium (Near the back)
description:
Need someone to talk to? We’re here for you. Join Atkins and CAPS for a brief, informal talk; no appointment needed. We're here to listen and support you. Swing by and talk to us today – we're just a conversation away.

This event is completely free, as is the light rail! The first 50 who register will receive a free $10 voucher to help purchase produce from the market, completely chosen by you! (Light rail directions will be emailed to those who register.) Register at this link.

name: Accountability Groups Spring 2025 - Wednesday at 5:30
description:
<!--StartFragment -->
Ever heard of body doubling?
Body doubling, also known as parallel working, is a productivity strategy where two or more people work on something independently but in the same space. Some students find they are better able to focus and get more done when they are studying alongside someone else studying.
 
What are Accountability Groups?
Accountability Groups meet weekly for 75 minutes and are facilitated by student leaders. The groups are designed to capitalize on the idea of body doubling by helping members practice productive study habits, connect them with peers, and provide dedicated time to work on individual tasks.
 
Join an Accountability Group through Connect! You can sign up as the semester goes on or ask to be placed in the same group weekly.
 
The group that meets on Mondays at 5:30pm is reserved for students with ADHD and ADHD-like experiences.
<!--EndFragment -->

name: Link for: Annual Student "College Culture" Survey
description:
Please consider taking a few moments to complete the college's annual student "College Culture" survey.  The survey is open to all students enrolled in the College of Engineering and will be available until 4/13 for you to complete.
We value your thoughts and feedback about a few areas pertaining to your educational experiences in the college. 
This is a general link, and no personal data is being collected.  You may use the anonymous link to access the survey. You may also copy and paste it into the browser of your choice.  
https://surveys.qualtrics.charlotte.edu/jfe/form/SV_3eNEX9i2wGcWCWy
Any information about your participation, including your identity, is completely confidential. You will not be personally identified in any reports that are generated as a result of your participation. Your privacy is protected under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Action of 1974 (FERPA).
The college thanks you for your time and we truly hope you will consider completing the survey.

name: Write Now!
description:
Are you working on a piece of writing? Could you benefit from some extra accountability and motivation to make progress? Then join us for Write Now!Modeled on the popular Shut Up and Write! program, each Write Now! session features two hours of structured writing time for you to focus on making progress on your writing. Participating in structured writing times benefits graduate and postdoctoral writers by allowing them to strengthen writing habits, make meaningful progress on writing projects, and improve attitudes about writing (Cayley et al., forthcoming; Tremblay-Wragg et al., 2021).Whether you're writing an article, working on a dissertation chapter, preparing to defend your thesis, or just trying to get some work done, Write Now! is right for you!Facilitator: Caitlin BrabbleRose
Register Here
host: The Center for Graduate Life and Learning

name: Upper South Cookout
description: Our 3rd annual Upper South Cookout is a joint event between Levine and Wilson Halls and our last, outdoors event of the year! Join us for games, freshly grilled hot dogs, veggie options, Pelican's Snoballs, sports, and more! April 30th at 6pm in the Upper South Courtyard is all you need to know about this event. See you there!
